pranav_p_joshi wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> 
> I am making a application to test the java base product. Now in order to 
> do that how to handle the exception. to be more specific, How to 
> diffrentiate the Product Exception and testing tool exception

A JUnit test either fails or generates an error.

USUALLY a failure means your code is wrong; USUALLY an error means the 
test /or/ the environment is wrong. An error happens when the test 
thrown an unexpected exception. That could happen because of bad code, a 
bad test or someone pulling the plug on the database.
